SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange regarding ''. State Bank of India has concluded the issue of USD 750 Mio Senior Unsecured Fixed Rate Notes having maturity of 5 years and coupon of 4.875% percent payable semi-annually under Regulation-S. The Bonds will be issued through our London branch as of 05th May 2023 and shall be listed on Singapore Stock Exchange and India International Exchange, GIFT City.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange regarding Outcome of Board Meeting held on April 18, 2023. The Executive Committee of the Central Board in its meeting on 18th April 2023 has approved, inter alia, the following: To examine the status and decide on long term fund raising in single / multiple tranches up to US$ 2 Billion (US$ Two Billion) under Reg-S/144A, through a public offer and/or private placement of senior unsecured notes in US Dollar or any other convertible currency during FY 2023-24.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from the Company with respect to news item captioned- "SBI finds fraud worth Rs.7951cr". It is incumbent upon the Exchanges in such situations to attempt to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported and to disseminate to the market place the clarification/information furnished by the company. In this regard, you are advised to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order. b) The material impact of this article on the Company. c) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under Regulation 30 of Listing Regulations. If so, you are advised to provide the said information and the reasons for not disclosing the same to the Exchange earlier as required under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations. SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from the Company with respect to news item captioned ￂﾓMassive data breach hits 6,000 Indian organisations including govt offices, banks: Quick Healￂﾔ. In this regards, the Bank informed the Exchange clarified that the breach mentioned in the report has been refuted by NIXI (National Internet Exchange of India). This article is published in ￂﾑThe Hindu-Business Lineￂﾒ dated 04.10.2017 wherein NIXI has clarified that there was no serious security breach of the Indian registry database as claimed by a hacker on the Darknet. However, our Information Security Department is being continuously monitoring for any attack.On receipt of any further information/clarification from our concerned department we will submit the same for your information/record.

SUBJECT: Qualified Institutional Placement
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that subsequent to the approval accorded by the Central Board, at its meeting held on January 15, 2016 and March 15, 2017 and the approval of the shareholders of the Bank by way of resolution dated February 26, 2016 and December 20, 2016 for the issue, the Committee of Directors for Capital Raising ( the " Committee) of the Central Board of the Bank , at its meeting held earlier June 05, 2017 has decided to open the Issue for receiving bids in accordance with the provisions of Chapter VIII of the SEBI ICDR Regulations. the Committee also approved and adopted the preliminary placement document dated June 05, 2017, in connection with the Issue. Further the company inform the exchange that the floor price in respect of the issue, based on the pricing formula as prescribed under Regulation 85(1) of the SEBI ICDR Regulations is Rs. 287.58 per equity share of the Bank and the 'relevnt date' for this purpose, in terms of Regulations 81(c)(I) of the SEBI ICDR Regulations, is june 05, 2017 . In accordance with the Regulaion 85(1) of the SEBI ICDR Regulations, the Bank may offer a discount of not more than 5% to the Floor Price.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from the Company with respect to recent news item captioned "SBI branch opened 2,000 accounts to channelise black money". In this regard, Exchange has advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company is aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under regulation 30 of Listing Regulations. The response from the Company is awaited.

DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from the Company with respect to news item captioned  3.2 million debit cards compromised; SBI, HDFC Bank, ICICI, YES Bank and Axis worst hit. If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company is aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under regulation 30 of Listing Regulations. The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from State Bank of India with respect to a news item captioned "Indian bank branches face closure amid UK crackdown". The Company has clarified that "Prudential Regulatory Authority (PRA), had sought opinion/ views of international banks operating in the UK jurisdiction by releasing a Consultation Paper (CP 4/14) in February 2014 on PRA's approach to branch supervision. After consolidating the responses received from various banks, PRA has come out with the final Supervisory Statement (SS/ 10/14) on 5th September 2014. In the policy statement, PRA has reiterated what they had mentioned in their Consultation Paper albeit with certain elaborations. As per the same, all new Branches coming in and wanting to undertake any of the Critical Economic Functions (CEFs) like Retail and those impacting systemic stability will have to come as subsidiary. For existing branches, PRA's approach will depend on factors like the nature of activities undertaken by the branch, de-minimis levels prescribed in case of retail banking, equivalence of Home State Supervisor (In our case Reserve Bank of India), acceptability of arrangements for resolution etc. Though SBI UK Operations undertake retail banking activities above the prescribed de-minimis levels, PRA is expected to take a position with regard to each non-EEA (European Economic Area) branch only after evaluating the Home State Supervisory equivalence, resolvability etc. SBI UK Operations will decide on their future banking model (Branch or Subsidiary) on receipt of the final evaluation from PRA. The article is not expected to have any material impact on SBI."

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that . "SBI to merge five subsidiary banks with itself as it prepares to fund the economy". The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company.  has vide its letter inter-alia stated," We clarify that no such proposal has been formally taken up for approval. While the Bank has always had plans to consider merger of the Associate Banks, eventually, a position which has been stated by the Bank from time to time since long, the matter had not been under active consideration for quite some time. Going forward, the Bank may examine the merger options afresh, when considered appropriate, but preparation of a possible roadmap would take few months."

Pradeep Kumar, Deputy Managing Director, State Bank of India, as Managing Director, State Bank of India, from the date of taking over the charge of the post and upto October 31, 2015  i.e. the date of his attaining the age of superannuation or until further orders, whichever is earlier.

SUBJECT: Strikes/Lockouts/Disturbances
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that UFBU has given a notice to IBA calling for nationwide Bank strike, on December 18, 2013. All India State Bank Officers' Federation and All India State Bank of India Staff Federation being part of UFBU will also participate in the said strike. Since the call is for nationwide All-bank strike, our Bank will not be separately impacted, if the strike materialises.

SUBJECT: Preferential issue
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Executive Committee of Central Board (ECCB) of the Bank, in its meeting held on December 12, 2013, has accorded its approval to fix the Issue Price at Rs. 1782.74 (Rupees One thousand seven hundred eighty two and paisa seventy four only) per share of face value of Rs.10/-, including a premium of Rs. 1772.74 per share, and accordingly, to issue 1,12,18,685 equity shares, ranking pari-passu with the existing equity shares of the Bank in all respects, on preferential basis to Gol, for a consideration of Rs. 1,999,99,98,496.90 (Rupees One thousand nine hundred ninety nine crores ninety nine lacs ninety eight thousand four hundred ninety six and paisa ninety only).  The price for preferential issue has been arrived at in accordance with the SEBI (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2009, taking into consideration November 29, 2013 as the relevant date.

To raise Rs. 9,576 crores of equity during the financial year 2013-14 from the market by way of Qualified Institutions Placement (QIP) as per law with the condition that the Gol holding shall not come down below 58%; and    2. To increase its  "Issued Capital"  by Rs. 11,576 crores [Rs. 2,000 crores (including premium) towards preferential allotment of equity shares in favour of Gol and Rs. 9,576 crores (including premium) towards raising of equity from the market] in accordance with Section 5(2) of SBI Act, 1955, subject to requisite approvals.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank wishes to announce the repurchase of principal amount of US$147,000,000 (the "Repurchase") of US$1,000,000,000 3.25 per cent bonds due 2018 (the "2018 bonds"). The 2018 Bonds were issued by State Bank of India on 18 April 2013 and are listed on the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited. The Repurchase of the Bond took place between August 26, 2013 and September 26, 2013. The Bank is in th process of cancelling the repurchased 2018 Bonds and the aggregate outstanding principal amount of the 2018 Bonds following such cancellation will be US$853,000,000. None of the Directors or the controlling shareholder of SBI have any interest, direct or indirect, in the Repurchase.

SUBJECT: Notice  of Meeting

In this connection, State Bank of India has now informed Exchange that the date of General Meeting of shareholders of the Bank to obtain their approval for the above preferential allotment has been fixed for March 19, 2012  and accordingly, in terms of the SEBI (ICDR) Regulations, the relevant date for the purpose of determining the price will be February 17, 2012.

SUBJECT: Outcome of meeting
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Executive Committee of Central Board (ECCB) of the Bank, in its meeting held on January 31, 2012, has accorded its approval under section 5(2) of the SBI Act, to increase the issued capital of the Bank by way of preferential allotment of equity shares to Government of India ("GoI") of such number of equity shares of Rs. 10 each for cash at a price to be determined by the ECCB in accordance with the SEBI (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2009, aggregating to the extent of approximately Rs. 7900 crore (including premium), to achieve minimum 8% Tier I CAR for the year by March 31, 2012, pursuant to the approval from the Reserve Bank of India and GoI for the increase in issued capital, in accordance with section 5(2) of the State Bank of India Act, 1955. (2)The date of the General Meeting of the Bank's shareholders to obtain their approval for the above preferential allotment of shares to GOI and the relevant date for the purpose of determining the price will be announced later.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India had informed the Exchange regarding the Executive Committee of the Central Board of the Bank had accorded approval for raising Tier II Capital for an aggregate amount of Rs. 10,000 crore by way of Public Issue of Subordinated Bonds (Lower Tier II Bonds) during the remaining period of FY 2010-11 and in FY 2011-12, in different tranches and also for raising of Rs. 1,000 crore with a green shoe option to retain Rs. 1,000 crore, along with an option to retain any amount of oversubscription under the Retail Category beyond Rs. 2000 crore but up to the rated amount of Rs. 10,000 crores, in the first tranche. The Bank has now informed the Exchange that the first tranche of the Issue opened on February 21, 2011 and closed on February 28, 2011. Further Executive Committee of the Central Board of the Bank, at its meeting held on March 16, 2011, has accorded approval for issue and allotment of 7,31,078 Series 3 Lower Tier II Bonds of face value Rs. 10,000.00 each and 47,65,918 Series 4 Lower Tier II Bonds of face value Rs. 10,000.00 each on March 16, 2011 to the eligible Applicants, in the first tranche, in terms of the Basis of Allotment approved on March 15, 2011. The Record Date for payment of Interest on the Bonds, for the first Year, i.e. for the period commencing from March 16, 2011 to March 31, 2011, shall be March 17, 2011.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Director
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Central Government in exercise of the powers confirmed by clause (cb) of Section 19 read with sub-section (3) of Section 20 of the State Bank of India Act, 1955 (23 of 1955) and Rule 4 of the State Bank of India (Appointment of Employee Directors) Rules, 1974, after consultation with Reserve Bank of India, has nominated Shri G. D. Nadaf (DoB: 01,06.1952), Deputy Manager, Local Head Office, Banglore as officer employee Director on the Central Board of Directors of State Bank of India for a period of three years from the date of notification or until he ceases to be an officer of the State Bank of India or until further orders, whichever is the earliest.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India had informed the Exchange that: "The Government of India has issued the "Acquisition of State Bank of Indore Order, 2010", in terms of which the entire undertaking of State Bank of Indore shall stand transferred to and vested in the State Bank of India from August 26, 2010". The Bank has now informed the Exchange vide its letter dated July 30, 2010 that: "In terms of the above Order, the Executive Committee of the Central Board of State Bank of India has today fixed August 11, 2010 as the Record Date for determining the eligible minority shareholders of State Bank of Indore entitled to receive 34 Equity Shares of face value of Rs. Ten (10) each, fully paid up, of State Bank of India for every 100 Equity Shares of face value of Rs. Ten (10) each, fully paid up, held by the aforesaid shareholders in State Bank of Indore.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that "The Government of India has issued the "Acquisition of State Bank of Indore Order, 2010" vide Order no - F.26/1/2009-BOA dated July 28, 2010. In terms of the said Order, the entire undertaking of State Bank of Indore shall stand transferred to and vested in the State Bank of India from the 30th day from the date of the Order, i.e. from August 26, 2010. The aforesaid Order has been issued under sub-section (2) of Section 35 of the State Bank of India Act, 1955."

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that "State Bank of India has concluded the issue of USD  1,000 Mio Fixed Rate Senior Unsecured Notes having a maturity of 5 years at a coupon of 4.50 percent payable semi-annually, under a Stand alone Bond Issue under Rule 144A/ Regulation-S Notes. The Bonds will be issued through our London branch as of 27th July, 2010 and shall be listed on Singapore Stock Exchange".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that "State Bank of India, on 14th July, 2010 signed a Joint Venture Agreement with State General Reserve Fund (SGRF), Sultanate of Oman to set up a General Purpose Private Equity Fund for investing in various assets in India. This is a part of sovereign level collaboration between the Government of India and the Government of Sultanate of Oman. The fund shall have initial target corpus of USD 100 million and is proposed to be expanded in future up to a level of USD 1.5 billion".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated June 29, 2010 that "State Bank of India has fixed the Base Rate at 7.50% per annum with effect from July 01, 2010".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank had advised approval for takeover of SBICAP Securities Ltd. by the State Bank of India (SBI) from SBI Capital Markets Ltd.(SBICAP) to make it a direct subsidiary of SBI. Further, it has now been decided that SSL may continue to function as a subsidiary of SBICAP for better synergies. Thus, the earlier proposal of taking over SSL as a direct subsidiary of SBI stands withdrawn.

SUBJECT: Date of payment of dividend
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the final payment of dividend @ Rs.20.00 per share (200%) will be made on July 12, 2010. Accordingly, the physical dividend warrants, wherever required, will be issued and will bear the date July 12, 2010 and will be payable at par at all State Bank of India branches, irrespective of the amount and the payment of dividend through electronic mode will be made on July 12, 2010.

Further the Register of shareholders of the Bank will be closed for transfer of shares from June 11, 2010 to June 16, 2010, both days inclusive, for payment of dividend for 2009-10, if any, to be considered at Bank's Central Board Meeting scheduled to be held on May 14, 2010.

The terms of arrangement are being worked out. RBI has already approved the setting up of a Wholly Owned Subsidiary for conducting Merchant Acquiring Business by SBI in the name of SBI Payment Services Private Limited."

As such, the unaudited results for the quarter-ended 31.03.2010 will not be published and given to the Stock Exchanges".

SUBJECT: Allotment of shares

Allotment of aforesaid shares was kept in abeyance as the Equity Shares in respect of which the above shares issued earlier were subject matter of title disputes/sub judice and the same are allotted after resolution of the dispute".

SUBJECT: Issue of Equity shares
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that:"The Central Board of the Bank, in its meeting held on 26.03.2010, has approved issuance of maximum 1,16,052 shares, of face value of Rs.10 each, to the minority shareholders of State Bank of Indore as on record date at the agreed swap ratio (34 shares of State Bank of India for every 100 shares of State Bank of Indore), resulting in increase in the issued Capital of State Bank of India from Rs634,96,85,000.00 to Rs.635,08,45,520.00 (maximum), subject to approval of the Scheme of Acquisition of State Bank of Indore by Government of India".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that "SBI General Insurance Company Ltd., a subsidiary of State Bank of India, has launched its limited operations. Initially, the business will be written within a limited geographical area with a few commercial products. The subsidiary is in the process of setting up its comprehensive IT infrastructure and is expected to commence full scale operations later during the year".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that "SBI and Societe Generale announce the launch of operations of their Joint Venture Company, SBI Custodial Services Private Limited".

SUBJECT: Updates

The said scheme is subject to approval by the Reserve Bank of India and the Government of India, under Section 35 of the SBI Act, 1955.

SUBJECT: Amalgamation
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Central Board of State Bank of India (SBI) and Boards of SBI Factors & Commercial Services Pvt. Ltd. ( SBI Factors ) and Global Trade Finance Ltd. ( GTFL ),( both subsidiaries of SBI ) have decided to amalgamate / merge SBI Factors with GTFL, subject to necessary regulatory approvals. Both these companies are in the business of factoring of receivables. SBI had acquired a majority shareholding in GTFL in March 2008 and at present holds 92.60% shares in GTFL. In SBI Factors, SBI And SBI group hold 64% & 70% shareholding respectively.

Interest expended of Rs. 877614 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-MAR-2008 against Rs. 722133 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-MAR-2007. Net Profit / (Loss) of Rs. 188325 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-MAR-2008 against Rs. 149319 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-MAR-2007.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that there will be no lock-in period in respect of shares to be allotted to employees of the Bank in terms of SBI Employee Share Purchase Scheme- 2008 (SBI ESPS-2008).

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that: "The Bank has extended the closing date of the Employee Share Purchase Scheme - 2008 from Tuesday, April 15, 2008 to Wednesday, April 30, 2008. All others terms and conditions of the Scheme remains same".

SUBJECT: Publish Audited Results
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the audited working results of the Bank for the year ended March 31, 2008 will be published within a period of 3 months of the close of the accounting year. As such, the unaudited results for the quarter-ended March 31, 2008 will not be published and given to the Stock Exchanges.

SUBJECT: Change in Directors
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that: "Consequent upon his superannuation, Shri Amar Pal, Non-Workmen Director has ceased to be a Director on Bank's Central Board w.e.f. 01.04.2008".

SUBJECT: Issue of bonds
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that "The Bank has finalised the issue of JPY 12 billion Fixed Rate Bonds for a tenor of 5 years at a Coupon of 3.36%. The Bonds will be issued as of 08th April, 2008."

SUBJECT: Share Purchase Agreement
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated March 25, 2008, that: "State Bank of India has today executed a Share Purchase Agreement with Exim Bank, IFC Washington and Fim Bank Malta to acquire their share holding in Global Trade Finance Limited (GTFL). As a result, SBI will hold 91% of the shareholding in GTFL".

SUBJECT: Issue of bonds
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that: "Our Bank has concluded a stand alone issuance of MYR 500 Mio Fixed Rate Bonds for a tenor of 5 years at a coupon of 4.90%. The Bonds will be issued as of 31st March, 2008".

SUBJECT: Appointment of Directors
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that: "The Central Government, in consultation with the Reserve Bank of India and in pursuance of clause (d) of Section 19 of the State Bank of India Act, 1955 (23 of 1955), has nominated Dr. (Mrs.) Vasantha Bharucha as a part-time non-official Director on the Central Board of State Bank of India for a period of three years with effect from 25th February 2008, vice Shri Piyush Goel".

SUBJECT: Rights Issue
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that: "We refer to the Rights Issue of State Bank of India which is scheduled to open for subscription from 18.02.2008. GOI had vide letter F.No. 11/7/2007-BOA dated 03.12.07, communicated that the subscription would be against the issue of SLR Marketable Government Securities". Further the Bank has informed the Exchange that however, the Government vide letter no. F.No.11/7/2007-BOA dated 14th February, 2008, has informed the Bank that the matter was revisited by the Government in the light of suggestions received by it from the Reserve Bank of India and it was decided that the subscription by the Government to the Rights Issue would be through issuance of Special Marketable Government Securities. Further, in this connection the Bank shall issue a corrigendum to the letter of offer for the attention of the equity shareholders of the Bank. The Bank has intimated SEBI in this regard and has also filed copies of the aforementioned Government letter dated 14th February 2008 and the proposed corrigendum with SEBI. The copies of the Government letter dated 14th February 2008 and Corrigendum to the Letter of Offer shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Purchase of shares
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that: "State Bank of India intends to purchase shareholding of Export-Import Bank of India (EXIM), IFC, Washington (IFC) and FIM Bank, Malta (FIM) in Global Trade Finance Ltd. (GTFL), aggregating to 91% of the total shareholding of GTFL, at an aggregate price of Rs. 520.55 cr. Approval from RBI for the purchase of these shares is awaited. As per RBI guidelines, a prior Public Notice of 30 days is required to be given by the sellers and buyer(s) before effecting the sale or transfer of the ownership of shares or transfer of control. Accordingly, a public notice is being issued jointly by Export-Import Bank of India (EXIM), IFC, Washington (IFC), FIM Bank, Malta (FIM) and SBI regarding the sale/purchase of shares subject to necessary permissions, consents and/or approval".

SUBJECT: Record Date

SUBJECT: Rights/Others
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that Central Board of the Bank at its meeting held on January 14, 2008 has decided as under (1) to increase the Issued Capital of Bank from Rs.526.30 crore to Rs.650.00 crore, in terms of Sec.5(2) of the SBI Act; (2) to raise an aggregate amount of Rs.16,736.31 crore (including premium) by way of Rights Issue offer to Government of India and to other eligible existing shareholders including GDR holders; (3) to issue shares to employees of the Bank under Employees Stock Purchase Scheme; (4) Ratio for Rights Issue: one share for every five shares held by the eligible shareholders as on the Record Date; (5) Price for Rights Issue: Rs. 1590 per share (i.e. face value of Rs.10 each and a premium of Rs.1580 per share).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India had informed the Exchange regarding a General Meeting of Shareholders of the Bank scheduled to be held on September 04, 2007, for the Election of Two Directors to the Central Board of the Bank, under provisions of Section 19(c) of State Bank of India Act, 1955. The Bank has now informed the Exchange that: "Further, consequent upon transfer of entire RBI's shareholding to Govt. of India (GoI) on 29.06.2007, certain amendments are necessitated in the SBI General Regulations to enable GoI representative alongwith the other shareholders, eligible to vote, to be present in the General Meeting to meet the quorum requirement. As such, it has been decided to postpone the election process till the relevant amendments are carried out and come into force.  The new date for filing of nomination and the date of General Meeting will be advised separately."

SUBJECT: Acquisition of shares
DETAILS: State Bank Of India had informed the Exchange that pursuant to the provisions contained in the Ordinance of Government of India, it had been agreed between the Reserve Bank of India and the Central Government that the entire shareholding of Reserve Bank of India aggregating 31,43,39,200 equity shares with a face value of Rs.10/- be transferred to the Central Government on June 29, 2007 against cash payment of Rs.35,531.33 crore. The Bank has now informed the Exchange that "the entire shareholding of Reserve Bank of India aggregating 31,43,39,200 equity shares with a face value of Rs 10/- each in state Bank of India was transferred to the Central Government on June 29, 2007".

SUBJECT: Payment of Dividend
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Central Board of the Bank in its meeting held on May 12, 2007, declared payment of dividend @ 14.00 per share. Accordingly, the dividend warrants will be issued and will bear the date of the July 20, 2007 and will be payable at par at all the branches of the Bank.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the provisions contained in the Ordinance of Government of India, it has been agreed between the Reserve Bank of India and the Central Government that the entire shareholding of Reserve Bank of India aggregating 31,43,39,200 equity shares with a face value of Rs.10/- be transferred to the Central Government on June 29, 2007 against cash payment of Rs.35,531.33 crore. A copy of the letter received from Department of Economic Affairs, (Banking Division), Ministry of Finance, Government of India, New Delhi, alongwith a copy of Gazette Notification of the Ordinance shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Acquisition of Equity
DETAILS: Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Economic Affairs (Banking Division)   has informed the Exchange that: "1) The proposal of Reserve Bank of India for transferring its entire shareholding in State Bank of India to Central Government was approved by the Cabinet in its meeting held on February 1, 2007. This decision of the Government was formally announced by the Finance Minister in his Budget Speech on February 28, 2007, and a sum of Rs.40,000 crore was provided in the Budget for the year 2007-08. 2) The State Bank of India (Amendment) Ordinance, 2007 (No.5 of 2007) amending the State Bank of India Act, 1955 to enable the transfer of Reserve Bank of India's entire shareholding in State Bank of India to Central Government has been promulgated on June 21, 2007. Pursuant to the provisions contained in the said Ordinance, it has been agreed between the Reserve Bank of India and the Central Government that the entire shareholding of Reserve Bank of India aggregating 31,43,39,200 equity shares with a face value of Rs.10/- each be transferred to the Central Government on June 29, 2007 against cash payment of Rs.35,531.33 crore".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that Bank has introduced a new term deposit product namely SBI Platinum Account from Jan. 22, 2007. The deposits under the scheme will carry interest rate of 9% P. A. compounded quarterly. Maximum period of deposit is three years. The depositor will have the right to exercise 'put options' to receive the deposit with accrued interest @ 8.25% p. a on expiry of one 1 year and @8.50% on expiry of two years. There is no provision for premature penalty for exercising put option. However, no interest will be paid if deposit is withdrawn before the completion of one year. The scheme is valid up to March 31st, 2007.

SUBJECT: Revision in Interest rates

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank has decided to revise Benchmark Prime Lending Rate with effect from August 02, 2006 as per details below : State Bank of India has revised upwards Benchmark Prime Lending rate (referred as SBAR) as under:  (i) Benchmark Prime Lending Rate (referred as SBAR) by 25 bps from 10.75% p.a. to 11.00% p.a with effect from August 2, 2006.  (ii) Term premia of 50 bps will be added as per extant instructions for loans with maturity of 3 years and above.  (iii) Credit risk premia (spreads) as per the existing Credit Risk Assessment (CRA) model of the Bank to be added to SBAR while fixing the pricing.

DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review for the un-audited financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2004 and the details of the same are available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Appointment of Managing Director
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that in exercise of the powers conferred by clause(b) of section 19 and sub-section(1) of section 20 of the State Bank of India Act,1955(23 of 1955),the central Government after consultation with the Reseve bank of India, appointed Shri Tara Shankar Bhattacharya,Deputy Managing Director, State Bank of India as Managing Director, State Bank of India w.e.f. the date of his taking charge and upto January 31,2008 i.e. the date of his superannuation or until further orders, whichever is earlier.

SUBJECT: Change in Management
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that Shri C.Bhattacharya, Managing Director & GE(CB) relinquished the office of the Managing Director of State Bank of India on the 31st January, 2005, i.e., on the date of  superannuation.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Auditors
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Reserve Bank of India, vide its notification No.DBS.ARS.No.402/08.21.002/2004-2005 dated January 01, 2005 have appointed following 14 Audit Firms as Statutory Central Auditors for the Bank in terms of section 41(i) of the State Bank of India Act, 1955 until the next AGM of the Bank:- 1) M/s B M Chatrath & Co., Kolkata; 2) M/s Khandelwal Jain & Co., Mumbai; 3) M/s G S Mathur & Co., New Delhi; 4) M/s S Viswanathan, Chennai; 5) M/s M M Nissim & Co., Mumbai;6)M/s O P Totla & Co.,Indore; 7) M/s Vinay Kumar & Co., Allahabad; 8) M/s Sarma & Co., Kolkata; 9) M/s Venugopal & Chenoy, Hyderabad; 10) M/s Patro & Co., Bhubaneswar; 11) M/s Kanwalia & Co., New Delhi; 12) M/s K P Rao & Co., Bangalore; 13) M/s Chaturvedi & Company, Kolkata; 14) M/s Phillipos & Co., Bangalore. Out of the 14 firms, the following firms have been newly appointed for 2004-2005 Statutory Audit : i) M/s Khandelwal Jain & Co., Mumbai; ii) M/s M M Nissim & Co., Mumbai; iii) M/s Vinay Kumar & Co., Allahabad; iv) M/s Patro & Co., Bhubaneswar; v) M/s Kanwalia & Co., New Delhi.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that they have finalized on February 3, 2005, with the principal shareholders of Indian Ocean International Bank Ltd (IOIB), Mauritius for acquisition of over 51% equity of the above Bank, along with management control therein.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that working of  10 Branches of the Bank in Andaman & Nicobar  Islands was affected due to the recent Tsunami  waves.   Out of the 10 Branches,  7 Branches have since started functioning normally now and efforts are on to restore normalcy to the remaining three branches also.

SUBJECT: Limited Review Report
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review for the un-audited financial results for the half year ended September 30, 2004 and the details of the same are available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the Memorandum of Understanding entered into between State Bank of India and Societe General Asset Management(SGAM) on 14th July, 2004 and final execution of documents in November, 2004,  the purchase consideration has been received from SGAM and 18,50,000 shares(constituting 37% of the total holding of 50,00,000 shares of  Rs.100/- each) held by State Bank of India in SBI Funds Management Pvt. Limited(SBIFMPL) have been transferred to SGAM on December 21, 2004.

SUBJECT: Revision in Interest rates
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank has decided to revise the interest rates on Domestic Term Deposits and on Housing Loans. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank has filed the Offering Circular for listing of the Medium Term Notes (MTN) Programme with Singapore Stock Exchange (SGX) on 12th November, 2004. The listing of the MTNs is expected to take place within a weeks time.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank is in the process of setting up an MTN (Medium Term Notes) programme for US $ 1 billion in about 3/4 issuances within a period of one year to augment the resources of the Bank's Foreign  Offices with stable and long tenor funds.

SUBJECT: Joint Venture
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the Memorandum of Understanding entered into between State Bank of India and Societe Generale Asset Management (SGAM) on July 14, 2004, Shareholders and Share Purchase Agreement between SBI and SGAM and other ancillary documents have been executed on November 5, 2004.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that All India State Bank Officers' Federation and All India SBI Staff Federation have jointly given a call for one day strike on  November 05, 2004.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank has recently entered into an International Representation Agreement with 'Western Union Financial Services Inc.' to offer payment of inward remittance arrangements from non-US countries, through the Banks STEPS enabled branches.

SUBJECT: Limited Review Report
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the auditors have conducted the limited review for the un-audited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2004 and the details of the same are available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Change in Nominee Director
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that RBI has nominated Smt. Shyamala Gopinath, Deputy Governor, RBI on the Central Board of State Bank of India vice Shri A.V. Sardesai.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: State Bank Of India has informed the Exchange that the Bank has entered into an agreement regarding bilaterally sharing ATMs with Andhra Bank on September 20, 2004, which has been opened to the customers.
